meanings.definition: To cause injury to (someone or something) again.
meanings.sent1: He reinjures his ankle while playing soccer.
meanings.sent2: She always reinjures her knee when she runs too much.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy cat reinjures its tail every time it tries to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge reinjures the trust of the villagers every time it creaks.
meanings.sent5: The careless chef reinjures the same cut finger every time he chops vegetables.

meanings.definition: To sustain a new injury after having previously been injured.
meanings.sent1: The athlete reinjures his shoulder during the championship.
meanings.sent2: After the car accident, she reinjures her back in a minor fall.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful hiker reinjures his ankle on the same rock twice in a row.
meanings.sent4: The fragile vase reinjures itself every time it is moved to a new spot.
meanings.sent5: The old tree reinjures its trunk every winter when heavy snow falls on it.
